intro: Ectrosia scabrida, commonly known as the roughleaf ectrosia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun exposure, making it suitable for cultivation in warm climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
